blocks.name: ax-4
blocks.content: Axiom of Quantified Implication. Axiom C4 of [Monk2] p. 105 and Theorem 19.20 of [Margaris] p. 90. It is restated as ~ alim for labeling consistency. It should be used only by ~ alim . (Contributed by NM, 21-May-2008.) Use ~ alim instead. (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: alim
blocks.content: Restatement of Axiom ~ ax-4 , for labeling consistency. It should be the only theorem using ~ ax-4 . (Contributed by NM, 10-Jan-1993.)

blocks.name: alimi
blocks.content: Inference quantifying both antecedent and consequent. (Contributed by NM, 5-Jan-1993.)

blocks.name: 2alimi
blocks.content: Inference doubly quantifying both antecedent and consequent. (Contributed by NM, 3-Feb-2005.)

blocks.name: ala1
blocks.content: Add an antecedent in a universally quantified formula. (Contributed by BJ, 6-Oct-2018.)

blocks.name: al2im
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ al2imi . Version of ~ alim for a nested implication. (Contributed by Alan Sare, 31-Dec-2011.)

blocks.name: al2imi
blocks.content: Inference quantifying antecedent, nested antecedent, and consequent. (Contributed by NM, 10-Jan-1993.)

blocks.name: alanimi
blocks.content: Variant of ~ al2imi with conjunctive antecedent. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 8-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: alimdh
blocks.content: Deduction form of Theorem 19.20 of [Margaris] p. 90, see ~ alim . (Contributed by NM, 4-Jan-2002.)

blocks.name: albi
blocks.content: Theorem 19.15 of [Margaris] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 24-Jan-1993.)

blocks.name: albii
blocks.content: Inference adding universal quantifier to both sides of an equivalence. (Contributed by NM, 7-Aug-1994.)

blocks.name: 2albii
blocks.content: Inference adding two universal quantifiers to both sides of an equivalence. (Contributed by NM, 9-Mar-1997.)

blocks.name: sylgt
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ sylg . (Contributed by BJ, 2-May-2019.)

blocks.name: sylg
blocks.content: A syllogism combined with generalization. Inference associated with ~ sylgt . General form of ~ alrimih . (Contributed by BJ, 4-Oct-2019.)

blocks.name: alrimih
blocks.content: Inference form of Theorem 19.21 of [Margaris] p. 90. See ~ 19.21 and ~ 19.21h . Instance of ~ sylg . (Contributed by NM, 9-Jan-1993.) (Revised by BJ, 31-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: hbxfrbi
blocks.content: A utility lemma to transfer a bound-variable hypothesis builder into a definition. See ~ hbxfreq for equality version. (Contributed by Jonathan Ben-Naim, 3-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: alex
blocks.content: Universal quantifier in terms of existential quantifier and negation. Dual of ~ df-ex . See also the dual pair ~ alnex / ~ exnal . Theorem 19.6 of [Margaris] p. 89. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.)

blocks.name: exnal
blocks.content: Existential quantification of negation is equivalent to negation of universal quantification. Dual of ~ alnex . See also the dual pair ~ df-ex / ~ alex . Theorem 19.14 of [Margaris] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.)

blocks.name: 2nalexn
blocks.content: Part of theorem *11.5 in [WhiteheadRussell] p. 164. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 24-May-2011.)

blocks.name: 2exnaln
blocks.content: Theorem *11.22 in [WhiteheadRussell] p. 160. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 24-May-2011.)

blocks.name: 2nexaln
blocks.content: Theorem *11.25 in [WhiteheadRussell] p. 160. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 24-May-2011.)

blocks.name: alimex
blocks.content: An equivalence between an implication with a universally quantified consequent and an implication with an existentially quantified antecedent. An interesting case is when the same formula is substituted for both ` ph ` and ` ps ` , since then both implications express a type of non-freeness. See also ~ eximal . (Contributed by BJ, 12-May-2019.)

blocks.name: aleximi
blocks.content: A variant of ~ al2imi : instead of applying ` A. x ` quantifiers to the final implication, replace them with ` E. x ` . A shorter proof is possible using ~ nfa1 , ~ sps and ~ eximd , but it depends on more axioms. (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 18-Aug-2019.)

blocks.name: alexbii
blocks.content: Biconditional form of ~ aleximi . (Contributed by BJ, 16-Nov-2020.)

blocks.name: exim
blocks.content: Theorem 19.22 of [Margaris] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 10-Jan-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 4-Jul-2014.)

blocks.name: eximi
blocks.content: Inference adding existential quantifier to antecedent and consequent. (Contributed by NM, 10-Jan-1993.)

blocks.name: 2eximi
blocks.content: Inference adding two existential quantifiers to antecedent and consequent. (Contributed by NM, 3-Feb-2005.)

blocks.name: eximii
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ eximi . (Contributed by BJ, 3-Feb-2018.)

blocks.name: exa1
blocks.content: Add an antecedent in an existentially quantified formula. (Contributed by BJ, 6-Oct-2018.)

Theorem 19.38 of [Margaris] p. 90. The converse holds under non-freeness conditions, see ~ 19.38a and ~ 19.38b . (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.) Allow a shortening of ~ 19.21t . (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 2-Jan-2018.)

blocks.name: 19.38a
blocks.content: Under a non-freeness hypothesis, the implication ~ 19.38 can be strengthened to an equivalence. See also ~ 19.38b . (Contributed by BJ, 3-Nov-2021.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 9-Jul-2022.)

blocks.name: 19.38b
blocks.content: Under a non-freeness hypothesis, the implication ~ 19.38 can be strengthened to an equivalence. See also ~ 19.38a . (Contributed by BJ, 3-Nov-2021.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 9-Jul-2022.)

blocks.name: imnang
blocks.content: Quantified implication in terms of quantified negation of conjunction. (Contributed by BJ, 16-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: alinexa
blocks.content: A transformation of quantifiers and logical connectives. (Contributed by NM, 19-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: alexn
blocks.content: A relationship between two quantifiers and negation. (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: 2exnexn
blocks.content: Theorem *11.51 in [WhiteheadRussell] p. 164. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 24-May-2011.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 25-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: exbi
blocks.content: Theorem 19.18 of [Margaris] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.)

blocks.name: exbii
blocks.content: Inference adding existential quantifier to both sides of an equivalence. (Contributed by NM, 24-May-1994.)

blocks.name: 2exbii
blocks.content: Inference adding two existential quantifiers to both sides of an equivalence. (Contributed by NM, 16-Mar-1995.)

blocks.name: 3exbii
blocks.content: Inference adding three existential quantifiers to both sides of an equivalence. (Contributed by NM, 2-May-1995.)

blocks.name: nfbiit
blocks.content: Equivalence theorem for the non-freeness predicate. Closed form of ~ nfbii . (Contributed by Giovanni Mascellani, 10-Apr-2018.) Reduce axiom usage. (Revised by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: nfbii
blocks.content: Equality theorem for the non-freeness predicate. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.) ~ df-nf changed. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 12-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: nfxfr
blocks.content: A utility lemma to transfer a bound-variable hypothesis builder into a definition. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.)

blocks.name: nfxfrd
blocks.content: A utility lemma to transfer a bound-variable hypothesis builder into a definition. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Sep-2016.)

blocks.name: nfnbi
blocks.content: A variable is non-free in a proposition if and only if it is so in its negation. (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.)

blocks.name: nfnt
blocks.content: If a variable is non-free in a proposition, then it is non-free in its negation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Sep-2016.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 28-Dec-2017.) (Revised by BJ, 24-Jul-2019.) ~ df-nf changed. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 4-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: nfn
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ nfnt . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.) ~ df-nf changed. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 18-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: nfnd
blocks.content: Deduction associated with ~ nfnt . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Sep-2016.)

blocks.name: exanali
blocks.content: A transformation of quantifiers and logical connectives. (Contributed by NM, 25-Mar-1996.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 4-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: exancom
blocks.content: Commutation of conjunction inside an existential quantifier. (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: exan
blocks.content: Place a conjunct in the scope of an existential quantifier. (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 13-Jan-2018.) Reduce axiom dependencies. (Revised by BJ, 7-Jul-2021.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 6-Nov-2022.) Expand hypothesis. (Revised by Steven Nguyen, 19-Jun-2023.)

blocks.name: exanOLD
blocks.content: Obsolete proof of ~ exan as of 19-Jun-2023. (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 13-Jan-2018.) Reduce axiom dependencies. (Revised by BJ, 7-Jul-2021.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 6-Nov-2022.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: exanOLDOLD
blocks.content: Obsolete proof of ~ exan as of 6-Nov-2022. (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 13-Jan-2018.) Reduce axiom dependencies. (Revised by BJ, 7-Jul-2021.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 8-Oct-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: alrimdh
blocks.content: Deduction form of Theorem 19.21 of [Margaris] p. 90, see ~ 19.21 and ~ 19.21h . (Contributed by NM, 10-Feb-1997.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 13-May-2011.)

blocks.name: eximdh
blocks.content: Deduction from Theorem 19.22 of [Margaris] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 20-May-1996.)

blocks.name: nexdh
blocks.content: Deduction for generalization rule for negated wff. (Contributed by NM, 2-Jan-2002.)

blocks.name: albidh
blocks.content: Formula-building rule for universal quantifier (deduction form). (Contributed by NM, 26-May-1993.)

blocks.name: exbidh
blocks.content: Formula-building rule for existential quantifier (deduction form). (Contributed by NM, 26-May-1993.)

blocks.name: exsimpl
blocks.content: Simplification of an existentially quantified conjunction. (Contributed by Rodolfo Medina, 25-Sep-2010.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 29-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: exsimpr
blocks.content: Simplification of an existentially quantified conjunction. (Contributed by Rodolfo Medina, 25-Sep-2010.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 29-Jun-2011.)
Theorem 19.40 of [Margaris] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 26-May-1993.)
Theorem 19.26 of [Margaris] p. 90. Also Theorem *10.22 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 147. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 4-Jul-2014.)
Theorem ~ 19.26 with two quantifiers. (Contributed by NM, 3-Feb-2005.)

blocks.name: 19.26-3an
blocks.content: Theorem ~ 19.26 with triple conjunction. (Contributed by NM, 13-Sep-2011.)
Theorem 19.29 of [Margaris] p. 90. See also ~ 19.29r . (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-1993.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 13-May-2011.)

blocks.name: 19.29r
blocks.content: Variation of ~ 19.29 . (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 12-Nov-2020.)

blocks.name: 19.29r2
blocks.content: Variation of ~ 19.29r with double quantification. (Contributed by NM, 3-Feb-2005.)

blocks.name: 19.29x
blocks.content: Variation of ~ 19.29 with mixed quantification. (Contributed by NM, 11-Feb-2005.)

Theorem 19.35 of [Margaris] p. 90. This theorem is useful for moving an implication (in the form of the right-hand side) into the scope of a single existential quantifier. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 27-Jun-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm 19.35(setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wb(wex(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1)))
} = {
  impbii(wex(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1)))
  com12(wex(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1))
  aleximi(s0, w0, wi(w0, w1), w1)
  pm2.27(w0, w1)
  ja(wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1), wex(s0, wi(w0, w1)))
  sylbir(wn(wal(s0, w0)), wex(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wex(s0, wn(w0)))
  exnal(s0, w0)
  eximi(s0, wn(w0), wi(w0, w1))
  pm2.21(w0, w1)
  exa1(s0, w1, w0)
}

blocks.name: 19.35i
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ 19.35 . (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-1993.)

blocks.name: 19.35ri
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ 19.35 . (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.)
Theorem 19.25 of [Margaris] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.)
Theorem 19.30 of [Margaris] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.)
Theorem 19.43 of [Margaris] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 27-Jun-2014.)

blocks.name: 19.43OLD
blocks.content: Obsolete proof of ~ 19.43 . Do not delete as it is referenced on the ~ mmrecent.html page and in ~ conventions-labels . (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm 19.43OLD(setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wb(wex(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1)))
} = {
  3bitr4i(wex(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1)), wn(wal(s0, wn(wo(w0, w1)))), wn(wa(wn(wex(s0, w0)), wn(wex(s0, w1)))))
  notbii(wal(s0, wn(wo(w0, w1))), wa(wn(wex(s0, w0)), wn(wex(s0, w1))))
  3bitri(wal(s0, wn(wo(w0, w1))), wa(wn(wex(s0, w0)), wn(wex(s0, w1))), wal(s0, wa(wn(w0), wn(w1))), wa(wal(s0, wn(w0)), wal(s0, wn(w1))))
  albii(s0, wn(wo(w0, w1)), wa(wn(w0), wn(w1)))
  ioran(w0, w1)
  19.26(s0, wn(w0), wn(w1))
  anbi12i(wal(s0, wn(w0)), wal(s0, wn(w1)), wn(wex(s0, w0)), wn(wex(s0, w1)))
  alnex(s0, w0)
  alnex(s0, w1)
  df-ex(s0, wo(w0, w1))
  oran(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1))
}

blocks.content: Theorem 19.33 of [Margaris] p. 90. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1993.)

blocks.name: 19.33b
blocks.content: The antecedent provides a condition implying the converse of ~ 19.33 . (Contributed by NM, 27-Mar-2004.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 5-Jul-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm 19.33b(setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wn(wa(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1))), wb(wal(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, w1))))
} = {
  impbid1(wn(wa(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1))), wal(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, w1)))
  sylbi(wn(wa(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1))), wi(wal(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, w1))), wo(wn(wex(s0, w0)), wn(wex(s0, w1))))
  ianor(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w1))
  jaoi(wn(wex(s0, w0)), wn(wex(s0, w1)), wi(wal(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, w1))))
  syl6com(wn(wex(s0, w0)), wal(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, w1)), wal(s0, w1))
  syl5bir(wal(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wn(wex(s0, w0)), wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, wn(w0)))
  alnex(s0, w0)
  al2imi(s0, wo(w0, w1), wn(w0), w1)
  pm2.53(w0, w1)
  olc(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w0))
  syl6com(wn(wex(s0, w1)), wal(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wo(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, w1)), wal(s0, w0))
  ord(wal(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wex(s0, w1), wal(s0, w0))
  orcomd(wal(s0, wo(w0, w1)), wex(s0, w1), wal(s0, w0))
  19.30(s0, w0, w1)
  orc(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, w1))
  19.33(s0, w0, w1)
}

blocks.content: Theorem *11.42 in [WhiteheadRussell] p. 163. Theorem 19.40 of [Margaris] p. 90 with two quantifiers. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 24-May-2011.)

blocks.name: 19.40b
blocks.content: The antecedent provides a condition implying the converse of ~ 19.40 . This is to ~ 19.40 what ~ 19.33b is to ~ 19.33 . (Contributed by BJ, 6-May-2019.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 13-Nov-2020.)

blocks.name: albiim
blocks.content: Split a biconditional and distribute quantifier. (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: 2albiim
blocks.content: Split a biconditional and distribute two quantifiers. (Contributed by NM, 3-Feb-2005.)

blocks.name: exintrbi
blocks.content: Add/remove a conjunct in the scope of an existential quantifier. (Contributed by Raph Levien, 3-Jul-2006.)

blocks.name: exintr
blocks.content: Introduce a conjunct in the scope of an existential quantifier. (Contributed by NM, 11-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: alsyl
blocks.content: Universally quantified and uncurried (imported) form of syllogism. Theorem *10.3 in [WhiteheadRussell] p. 150. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 8-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: nfimd
blocks.content: If in a context ` x ` is not free in ` ps ` and ` ch ` , then it is not free in ` ( ps -> ch ) ` . Deduction form of ~ nfim . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Sep-2016.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 30-Dec-2017.) ~ df-nf changed. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 18-Sep-2021.) Eliminate curried form of ~ nfimt . (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 10-Jul-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm nfimd(setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(w0, wnf(s0, wi(w1, w2)))
  -| wi(w0, wnf(s0, w1))
  -| wi(w0, wnf(s0, w2))
} = {
  nfd(s0, w0, wi(w1, w2))
  syl56(w0, wex(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wi(wal(s0, w1), wex(s0, w2)), wi(wex(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)))
  biimpi(wex(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wi(wal(s0, w1), wex(s0, w2)))
  19.35(s0, w1, w2)
  imim12d(w0, wal(s0, w1), wex(s0, w2), wex(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2))
  nfrd(s0, w0, w1)
  nfrd(s0, w0, w2)
  19.38(s0, w1, w2)
}

blocks.name: nfimt
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ nfim and ~ nfimd . (Contributed by BJ, 20-Oct-2021.) Eliminate curried form, former name nfimt2. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 6-Jul-2022.)

blocks.name: nfim
blocks.content: If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` and ` ps ` , then it is not free in ` ( ph -> ps ) ` . Inference associated with ~ nfimt . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 2-Jan-2018.) ~ df-nf changed. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 17-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: nfand
blocks.content: If in a context ` x ` is not free in ` ps ` and ` ch ` , then it is not free in ` ( ps /\ ch ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Oct-2016.)

blocks.name: nf3and
blocks.content: Deduction form of bound-variable hypothesis builder ~ nf3an . (Contributed by NM, 17-Feb-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2016.)

blocks.name: nfan
blocks.content: If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` and ` ps ` , then it is not free in ` ( ph /\ ps ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 13-Jan-2018.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 9-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: nfnan
blocks.content: If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` and ` ps ` , then it is not free in ` ( ph -/\ ps ) ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 2-Jan-2018.)

blocks.name: nf3an
blocks.content: If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` , ` ps ` , and ` ch ` , then it is not free in ` ( ph /\ ps /\ ch ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.)

blocks.name: nfbid
blocks.content: If in a context ` x ` is not free in ` ps ` and ` ch ` , then it is not free in ` ( ps <-> ch ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Sep-2016.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 29-Dec-2017.)

blocks.name: nfbi
blocks.content: If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` and ` ps ` , then it is not free in ` ( ph <-> ps ) ` . (Contributed by NM, 26-May-1993.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 2-Jan-2018.)

blocks.name: nfor
blocks.content: If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` and ` ps ` , then it is not free in ` ( ph \/ ps ) ` . (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.)

blocks.name: nf3or
blocks.content: If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` , ` ps ` , and ` ch ` , then it is not free in ` ( ph \/ ps \/ ch ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.)
